alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 1:48PM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MONDAY TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected with some blowing snow possible Monday night. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts near the southern Laramie Range. Dangerous wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...The Laramie Valley and the southern Laramie Range including the city of Laramie and the Interstate 80 Summit. * WHEN...From 3 PM Monday to 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
